org.apache.logging.log4j.spi

Interface ReadOnlyThreadContextMap


  • public interface ReadOnlyThreadContextMap
    Read-only view of the data structure that implements MDC behavior for ThreadContext.

    ThreadContextMap implementations that also implement this interface can be accessed by applications via the ThreadContext.getThreadContextMap() method.

    Since:
    2.8
    See Also:
    ThreadContext.getThreadContextMap()

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clear()
      Clears the localContext.
      boolean containsKey(String key)
      Determines if the key is in the localContext.
      String get(String key)
      Gets the localContext identified by the key parameter.
      Map<String,String> getCopy()
      Gets a non-null mutable copy of current thread's localContext Map.
      Map<String,String> getImmutableMapOrNull()
      Returns an immutable view on the localContext Map or null if the localContext map is empty.
      StringMap getReadOnlyContextData()
      Returns the localContext data for reading.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Returns true if the Map is empty.

    • Method Detail

      • clear

        void clear()
        Clears the localContext.

      • containsKey

        boolean containsKey(String key)
        Determines if the key is in the localContext.
        Parameters:
        key - The key to locate.
        Returns:
        True if the key is in the localContext, false otherwise.

      • get

        String get(String key)
        Gets the localContext identified by the key parameter.

        This method has no side effects.

        Parameters:
        key - The key to locate.
        Returns:
        The value associated with the key or null.

      • getCopy

        Map<String,String> getCopy()
        Gets a non-null mutable copy of current thread's localContext Map.
        Returns:
        a mutable copy of the localContext.

      • getImmutableMapOrNull

        Map<String,String> getImmutableMapOrNull()
        Returns an immutable view on the localContext Map or null if the localContext map is empty.
        Returns:
        an immutable localContext Map or null.

      • getReadOnlyContextData

        StringMap getReadOnlyContextData()
        Returns the localContext data for reading. Note that regardless of whether the returned localContext data has been frozen (made read-only) or not, callers should not attempt to modify the returned data structure.

        Thread safety note:

        If this ReadOnlyThreadContextMap implements CopyOnWrite, then the returned StringMap can safely be passed to another thread: future changes in the underlying localContext data will not be reflected in the returned StringMap.

        Otherwise, if this ReadOnlyThreadContextMap does not implement CopyOnWrite, then it is not safe to pass the returned StringMap to another thread because changes in the underlying localContext may be reflected in the returned object. It is the responsibility of the caller to make a copy to pass to another thread.

        Returns:
        a StringMap containing localContext data key-value pairs

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Returns true if the Map is empty.
        Returns:
        true if the Map is empty, false otherwise.
